summary: This is an internal email from an FBI Special Agent in New York, dated June 22, 2020, discussing the imminent arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. It indicates coordination with the SDNY (Southern District of New York) about potentially moving up the arrest timeline from August to within the next few weeks and mentions the need for follow-up travel and interviews post-arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email states the FBI is in the process of charging her and planning her arrest, initially thought for August but possibly moved up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded question from 'The DD' (likely a Deputy Director or senior official) asking about the status of his case and what remains to be done.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: The sender of the main email, providing an update on the Maxwell arrest plan and coordination with SDNY.

connections.description: Maxwell is the subject of a related investigation following Epstein's case, as indicated by the email discussing her arrest in the context of a question about Epstein.
The FBI agent is leading or involved in the process of charging and arresting Maxwell.

events.title: Internal FBI email on Maxwell arrest planning
events.description: An FBI Special Agent emails colleagues about the ongoing process to charge and arrest Ghislaine Maxwell, noting a conference call with SDNY to discuss moving the arrest timeline up from August to within the next few weeks.

events.title: SDNY conference call on Maxwell case
events.description: Planned conference call between the FBI and the Southern District of New York to coordinate the timing of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

events.title: Senior official inquiry on Epstein case status
events.description: 'The DD' (likely a Deputy Director) asks a question about what remains to be done in the Jeffrey Epstein case, prompting the internal email chain.

keyFacts: As of June 22, 2020, the FBI was actively planning the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell and considering moving the timeline up from August to within weeks.
The FBI New York field office was coordinating the arrest plan with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The email indicates senior leadership ('The DD') was inquiring about the status of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation and what work remained.
Post-arrest travel for follow-up interviews was anticipated as part of the Maxwell investigation.
